name: Caterpie

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.

name: Metapod

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Quiver Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

name: Seedot

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

name: Nuzleaf
flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Leaf Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Grass Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Deranged Dance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

flavorText: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.

name: Roselia

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.

name: Roserade

attacks.name: Whiplash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Exciting Shake
attacks.text: During your next turn, flip 6 coins instead of 2 for this Pokémon's Prickly Needles attack.

attacks.name: Prickly Needles
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

name: Litleo
flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Litleo
flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Pyroar

abilities.name: Intimidating Mane
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Fang
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

name: Qwilfish

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

name: Feebas

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted streams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.

name: Milotic

abilities.name: Energy Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, attach 3 basic Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX).

flavorText: Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.

name: Spheal
flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy they clap fins.

name: Sealeo

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

name: Walrein

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Tusk
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

name: Luvdisc

attacks.name: Heart Wink
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't draw a card at the beginning of his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

name: Buizel

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Rescue
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

name: Avalugg

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

flavorText: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

name: Shinx

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Luxio

attacks.name: Electricounter
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken.

flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

name: Luxray

attacks.name: Fang Snipe
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey–even those taking shelter behind a wall.

name: Magnezone-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Parabolic Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

name: Duskull

attacks.name: Revival
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Shadow Void
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pain Pellets
attacks.text: Put damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

name: Toxicroak-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Espurr

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

name: Meowstic

attacks.name: Ear Influence
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

name: Skrelp

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

name: Graveler

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

name: Golem

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

name: Binacle

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

name: Barbaracle

attacks.name: Rock Rush
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

flavorText: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Flash Claw
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

name: Weavile

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

name: Stunky

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

name: Stunky

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

name: Skuntank

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

name: Sandile

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

name: Scraggy

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.

name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

name: Forretress

abilities.name: Thorn Tempest
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Crash
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

name: Durant

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: Discard cards from your opponent's hand at random until he or she has 4 cards in his or her hand.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

name: Floette

abilities.name: Flower Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon in play gets +20 HP.

flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

name: Floette

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

name: Florges

attacks.name: Brilliant Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

name: Spritzee

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

name: Carbink

attacks.name: Crystal Barrier
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wonder Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fairy Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Born from temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Blaze
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

name: Druddigon

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

name: Dragalge

abilities.name: Poison Barrier
abilities.text: Your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

name: Goomy

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.

name: Sliggoo

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

name: Goodra

abilities.name: Gooey Regeneration
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heavy Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Peck Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.

name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Strong Gust
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Strong Gust attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

name: Kangaskhan-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Kindred Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: M Kangaskhan-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wham Bam Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Stir and Snooze
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Asleep, flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, this Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Sleepy Press
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

name: Sentret
flavorText: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

name: Furret

attacks.name: Buried Treasure Hunt
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

name: Miltank

attacks.name: Powerful Friends
attacks.text: If you have any Stage 2 Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

name: Buneary

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

name: Lopunny

abilities.name: Big Jump
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Sitdown Bounce
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

name: Fletchling

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

name: Blacksmith
rules: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Fiery Torch
rules: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a Fire Energy card, you can't play this card.) Draw 2 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Lysandre
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Magnetic Storm
rules: Each Pokémon in play has no Resistance.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Pal Pad
rules: Shuffle 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Protection Cube
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all damage done to the Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks it uses.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sacred Ash
rules: Shuffle 5 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Startling Megaphone
rules: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Trick Shovel
rules: Look at the top card of either player's deck. You may discard that card or return it to the top of the deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Magnezone-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Toxicroak-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Kangaskhan-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Kindred Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Lysandre
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

name: M Charizard-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Blaze
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

name: M Kangaskhan-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wham Bam Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Blacksmith
rules: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Avalugg  (FLF 31) (Promo)

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

flavorText: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

name: Fiery Torch (FLF 89) (Promo)
rules: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a Fire Energy card, you can't play this card.) Draw 2 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Magnetic Storm (FLF 91) (Promo)
rules: Each Pokémon in play has no Resistance.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Pokémon Fan Club (FLF 94) (Promo)
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).
